module.p:
eun beag a little bird –
Chunnaic mi eun beag ann an craoibh agus iolair air creig.
I saw a little bird in a tree and an eagle on a rock. td. 236

eun ann an craoibh a bird in a tree –
Dh’ fhàg Màiri agus Seumas an taigh tràth anns a’ mhadainn. Bha an latha blàth, agus bha na h-eòin a’ seinn anns na craobhan.
Mary and James left the house early in the morning. The day was warm, and the birds were singing in the trees. td. 76 [adapted]

eun am measg chreag a bird among rocks –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. [...] Bha latha briagha ann agus bha a’ ghrian a’ deàrrsadh. Cha robh neul anns an adhar. Bha an uiseag a’ seinn os cionn a chinn agus bha na h-eòin a’ ceileireadh am measg nan creag.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. [...] It was a beautiful day and the sun was shining. There wasn’t a cloud in the sky. The lark was singing above his head and the birds were warbling among the rocks. td. 146

seinn eun a bird sings –
Dh’ fhàg Màiri agus Seumas an taigh tràth anns a’ mhadainn. Bha an latha blàth, agus bha na h-eòin a’ seinn anns na craobhan.
Mary and James left the house early in the morning. The day was warm, and the birds were singing in the trees. td. 76 [adapted]

ceileir eun a bird warbles –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. [...] Bha latha briagha ann agus bha a’ ghrian a’ deàrrsadh. Cha robh neul anns an adhar. Bha an uiseag a’ seinn os cionn a chinn agus bha na h-eòin a’ ceileireadh am measg nan creag.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. [...] It was a beautiful day and the sun was shining. There wasn’t a cloud in the sky. The lark was singing above his head and the birds were warbling among the rocks. td. 146

éisd ri eun listen to a bird –
Bha Calum sgìth a’ coiseachd air a’ mhonadh, ach mu dheireadh ràinig e mullach na beinne. [...] Bha latha briagha ann agus bha a’ ghrian a’ deàrrsadh. Cha robh neul anns an adhar. Bha an uiseag a’ seinn os cionn a chinn agus bha na h-eòin a’ ceileireadh am measg nan creag. ’S toigh le Calum a bhith ag éisdeachd ris na h-eòin.
Malcolm was tired walking on the moor, but at last he reached the top of the mountain. [...] It was a beautiful day and the sun was shining. There wasn’t a cloud in the sky. The lark was singing above his head and the birds were warbling among the rocks. Calum likes to listen to the birds. td. 146
